description.zh-cn: 位于西欧的半总统制共和国，是世界主要强国之一，在军事、经济、文化、政治等领域均有全球性的显著影响力。
description.en: A semi-presidential republic in Western Europe, one of the world's major powers with significant global influence in military, economic, cultural, and political spheres.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治人物，现任法兰西共和国总统。
description.en: French politician, current President of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治人物，法兰西共和国总理。
description.en: French politician, Prime Minister of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治人物，现任法国参议院议长。
description.en: French politician, current President of the French Senate.

description.zh-cn: 法国议会的上议院。
description.en: The upper house of the French Parliament.

description.zh-cn: 查理曼的三位孙子于843年8月签署的条约，将加洛林帝国一分为三。
description.en: A treaty signed in August 843 by the three grandsons of Charlemagne, which divided the Carolingian Empire into three kingdoms.

description.zh-cn: 根据《凡尔登条约》从加洛林帝国分裂出的王国，为法兰西王国的前身。
description.en: A kingdom that emerged from the division of the Carolingian Empire by the Treaty of Verdun, and the predecessor to the Kingdom of France.

description.zh-cn: 法兰克公爵，后成为法兰克国王，建立了卡佩王朝。
description.en: Duke of the Franks who became King of the Franks and founded the Capetian dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 一个位于西欧的君主制国家，是现代法兰西共和国的前身。
description.en: A monarchy in Western Europe, the predecessor of the modern French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 18世纪末在法国爆发的革命，推翻了旧制度，建立了共和国，并深刻影响了欧洲乃至世界历史。
description.en: A revolution in France at the end of the 18th century that overthrew the Ancien Régime, established a republic, and profoundly influenced European and world history.

description.zh-cn: 法国大革命期间建立的第一个共和国政权。
description.en: The first republican government established during the French Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲联盟的前身，由三个欧洲共同体组成。
description.en: The predecessor to the European Union, consisting of three European communities.

description.zh-cn: 由夏尔·戴高乐于1958年建立的法国当前共和政体。
description.en: The current republican system of government in France, established by Charles de Gaulle in 1958.

description.zh-cn: 法国军事家、政治家，曾领导自由法国抵抗运动，并创立了法兰西第五共和国。
description.en: French general and statesman who led the Free French Forces during World War II and founded the French Fifth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 法国卡佩王朝国王，通过扩大王权和领土，使法国成为欧洲最强大的国家。
description.en: A king of France from the House of Capet who made France the most powerful country in Europe by expanding royal power and territory.

description.zh-cn: 位于中欧的多民族政治联合体，在腓力二世时期与法国为敌。
description.en: A multi-ethnic political complex in Central Europe, an enemy of France during the reign of Philip II.

description.zh-cn: 12世纪由金雀花王朝统治的西欧领土集合，在布汶战役中被法国击败。
description.en: A collection of states in Western Europe ruled by the House of Plantagenet in the 12th century, defeated by France at the Battle of Bouvines.

description.zh-cn: 英格兰王国和法兰西王国之间，以及两国封建领主之间的一系列军事冲突。
description.en: A series of military conflicts between the Kingdom of England and the Kingdom of France, and between their feudal lords.

description.zh-cn: 位于大不列颠岛南部的君主制国家，在百年战争中与法兰西王国交战。
description.en: A sovereign state on the southern part of the island of Great Britain, which fought against the Kingdom of France in the Hundred Years' War.

description.zh-cn: 法国波旁王朝国王，被称为“太阳王”，其统治时期是法国君主专制的顶峰，法国国力达到巅峰。
description.en: King of France from the House of Bourbon, known as the 'Sun King.' His reign marked the apogee of French absolute monarchy and the height of French power.

description.zh-cn: 由法国国王亨利四世于1598年颁布的敕令，承认了法国国内雨格诺派的信仰自由，后被路易十四废除。
description.en: An edict promulgated in 1598 by King Henry IV of France that granted substantial rights to the Huguenots in France. It was later revoked by Louis XIV.

description.zh-cn: 18世纪中叶爆发的一场全球性军事冲突，法国在此战中失利，失去了大量海外殖民地。
description.en: A global military conflict in the mid-18th century. France's defeat in this war resulted in the loss of many of its overseas colonies.

description.zh-cn: 法国波旁王朝末代国王，在法国大革命中被处决。
description.en: The last king of France from the House of Bourbon, executed during the French Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 北美十三殖民地反抗英国统治的独立战争，法国的支援对其成功至关重要。
description.en: The war of independence waged by the Thirteen Colonies in North America against British rule, in which French support was crucial to their success.

description.zh-cn: 指法国大革命前，瓦卢瓦王朝和波旁王朝时期的政治和社会制度。
description.en: The political and social system of the Kingdom of France from the Late Middle Ages until the French Revolution.

en: Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen

description.zh-cn: 法国大革命的纲领性文件，确立了自由、财产、安全和反抗压迫等基本人权。
description.en: A fundamental document of the French Revolution, defining the individual and collective rights of all the estates of the realm as universal.

description.zh-cn: 法国军事家、政治家与法学家，法兰西第一帝国皇帝。
description.en: French military and political leader who rose to prominence during the French Revolution and became Emperor of the First French Empire.

description.zh-cn: 指1792年到1815年间欧洲各国为了对抗新兴的法兰西共和国以及后来的法兰西第一帝国所结成的同盟。
description.en: A series of alliances formed by various European states to combat the French Republic and later the First French Empire between 1792 and 1815.

description.zh-cn: 由拿破仑·波拿巴建立的君主制帝国，一度统治欧洲大陆大部分地区。
description.en: An empire established by Napoleon Bonaparte that dominated much of continental Europe.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪初由法兰西第一帝国与反法同盟之间发生的一系列战争。
description.en: A series of major conflicts pitting the French Empire and its allies, led by Napoleon I, against a fluctuating array of European powers formed into various coalitions.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑战争中的最后一场战役，拿破仑在此战中战败，导致其统治的终结。
description.en: The final battle of the Napoleonic Wars, in which Napoleon was defeated, leading to the end of his rule.

description.zh-cn: 普鲁士王国与法兰西第二帝国之间的战争，法国的战败导致了第二帝国的垮台和法兰西第三共和国的建立。
description.en: A conflict between the Second French Empire and the Kingdom of Prussia. France's defeat led to the collapse of the Second Empire and the establishment of the Third Republic.

description.zh-cn: 法兰西第二共和国总统及法兰西第二帝国皇帝，拿破仑一世的侄子。
description.en: The only President of the French Second Republic and the Emperor of the Second French Empire; nephew of Napoleon I.

description.zh-cn: 由拿破仑三世建立的君主制政权，在普法战争中战败后瓦解。
description.en: A monarchical regime established by Napoleon III, which collapsed after its defeat in the Franco-Prussian War.

description.zh-cn: 在普法战争后建立的共和政权，经历了第一次世界大战，在第二次世界大战中被德国占领后终结。
description.en: The republican government established after the Franco-Prussian War, which endured World War I and ended after the German occupation in World War II.

description.zh-cn: 一场主要发生在欧洲的全球性战争，法国是协约国的核心力量之一，虽取得胜利但损失惨重。
description.en: A global war centered in Europe, in which France was one of the core powers of the Allied forces. Despite being victorious, France suffered immense losses.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战中与同盟国对立的军事联盟，于1940年占领法国。
description.en: A military coalition that fought against the Allies in World War II and occupied France in 1940.

description.zh-cn: 由夏尔·戴高乐在第二次世界大战期间于伦敦组建的流亡政府，领导法国抵抗运动。
description.en: An exile government led by Charles de Gaulle during World War II, based in London, which led the French Resistance.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战中盟军在欧洲西线战场发起的一场大规模登陆作战，是解放法国的关键战役。
description.en: The Allied landing operations on the Western Front of World War II, a pivotal battle for the liberation of France.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战中盟军在法国南部发动的登陆行动，与诺曼底登陆相配合，加速了法国的解放。
description.en: The Allied invasion of Southern France during World War II, which complemented the Normandy landings and accelerated the liberation of France.

nodes.id: 法兰西共和国临时政府

zh-cn: 法兰西共和国临时政府
en: Provisional Government of the French Republic

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战法国解放后由戴高乐成立的临时政府，为法兰西第四共和国的建立奠定了基础。
description.en: An interim government established by Charles de Gaulle after the liberation of France in World War II, laying the foundation for the Fourth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 战后建立的共和政权，因阿尔及利亚战争引发的政治危机而终结。
description.en: The republican government established after World War II, which ended due to the political crisis caused by the Algerian War.

description.zh-cn: 法属印度支那殖民地爆发的战争，法国最终战败，导致其殖民统治的终结。
description.en: A conflict in French Indochina, which resulted in a French defeat and the end of its colonial rule in the region.

description.zh-cn: 阿尔及利亚争取独立的战争，导致了法兰西第四共和国的垮台和阿尔及利亚的独立。
description.en: A war for Algerian independence that led to the collapse of the French Fourth Republic and the independence of Algeria.

description.zh-cn: 北非国家，曾是法国的殖民地，后通过独立战争获得独立。
description.en: A country in North Africa, formerly a French colony, which gained independence through a war.

description.zh-cn: 法国与阿尔及利亚民族解放阵线签署的停火协议，结束了阿尔及利亚战争，承认了阿尔及利亚的独立。
description.en: A ceasefire agreement signed between France and the Algerian National Liberation Front, which ended the Algerian War and recognized Algeria's independence.

description.zh-cn: 法国和西德签订的友好合作条约，是法德和解的重要里程碑。
description.en: A treaty of friendship and cooperation between France and West Germany, a major milestone in Franco-German reconciliation.

description.zh-cn: 德意志联邦共和国在两德统一前的通称，与法国在战后致力于发展友好关系。
description.en: The common name for the Federal Republic of Germany before reunification, which worked towards developing friendly relations with France after the war.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲和北美国家为实现防卫协作而建立的国际组织，法国是其创始成员国之一。
description.en: An international organization established by European and North American countries for collective defense, of which France is a founding member.

description.zh-cn: 由欧洲多个国家组成的政治和经济联盟，法国是其创始成员国和核心国家。
description.en: A political and economic union of states located primarily in Europe, of which France is a founding and core member.

description.zh-cn: 法国的科学学术机构，由路易十四设立，旨在激励和保护法国的科学研究。
description.en: A learned society in France, founded by Louis XIV to encourage and protect the spirit of French scientific research.

description.zh-cn: 法国发明家奥古斯特·卢米埃和路易·卢米埃兄弟，被认为是电影和电影放映机的发明人。
description.en: The French inventors Auguste and Louis Lumière, who are credited with inventing the cinematograph.

description.zh-cn: 一种表演艺术、视觉艺术及听觉艺术，法国被认为是其发源地。
description.en: A form of performance, visual, and auditory art, with France being considered its birthplace.

description.zh-cn: 法国启蒙时代思想家、哲学家、作家，其政治哲学深刻影响了法国大革命和现代民主思想。
description.en: A French Enlightenment philosopher, writer, and composer whose political philosophy influenced the progress of the French Revolution and modern democratic thought.

description.zh-cn: 由卢梭撰写的政治哲学著作，提出了主权在民的理论。
description.en: A work of political philosophy by Jean-Jacques Rousseau that theorizes about the best way to establish a political community, based on popular sovereignty.

description.zh-cn: 一种共和制政体，其行政部门（政府）的权力来自立法部门（议会）的支持。
description.en: A type of republic that operates under a parliamentary system of government where the executive branch (the government) derives its legitimacy from and is accountable to the legislature (the parliament).

description.zh-cn: 一个由主权国家组成的国际组织，致力于促进各国在国际法、国际安全、经济发展、社会进步、人权及实现世界和平方面的合作。法国是其创始会员国及安理会常任理事国。
description.en: An international organization whose stated aims are to facilitate co-operation in international law, international security, economic development, social progress, human rights, and achieving world peace. France is a founding member and a permanent member of the Security Council.

description.zh-cn: 埃马纽埃尔·马克龙于2017年5月14日就任法兰西共和国总统。
description.en: Emmanuel Macron took office as President of the French Republic on May 14, 2017.

description.zh-cn: 塞巴斯蒂安·勒科尔尼是法兰西共和国总理。
description.en: Sébastien Lecornu is the Prime Minister of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 热拉尔·拉尔谢担任法国参议院议长。
description.en: Gérard Larcher serves as the President of the French Senate.

description.zh-cn: 《凡尔登条约》将加洛林帝国分割，从而建立了西法兰克王国。
description.en: The Treaty of Verdun divided the Carolingian Empire, leading to the establishment of West Francia.

description.zh-cn: 于格·卡佩于987年即位为王，被后世视为法兰西王国的开端。
description.en: Hugh Capet's accession to the throne in 987 is considered by posterity as the beginning of the Kingdom of France.

description.zh-cn: 腓力二世在布汶战役中战胜了神圣罗马帝国与安茹帝国的联军。
description.en: Philip II defeated the allied forces of the Holy Roman Empire and the Angevin Empire at the Battle of Bouvines.

description.zh-cn: 腓力二世在布汶战役中战胜了神圣罗马帝国与安茹帝国的联军。
description.en: Philip II defeated the allied forces of the Holy Roman Empire and the Angevin Empire at the Battle of Bouvines.

description.zh-cn: 在14至15世纪，法国与英格兰王国爆发百年战争。
description.en: In the 14th and 15th centuries, France fought the Hundred Years' War against the Kingdom of England.

description.zh-cn: 路易十四撕毁《南特敕令》，取消了雨格诺派的信仰自由。
description.en: Louis XIV revoked the Edict of Nantes, abolishing the religious freedom of the Huguenots.

description.zh-cn: 法国在七年战争中失利，其世界强权地位被英国取代，并失去了在美洲和印度的广大殖民地。
description.en: France was defeated in the Seven Years' War, its position as a world power was replaced by Britain, and it lost vast colonies in America and India.

description.zh-cn: 路易十六以大量资金与派遣舰队支持美国独立。
description.en: Louis XVI supported American independence with substantial funds and fleets.

description.zh-cn: 对美国独立战争的支持酿成了法国的财政危机，为大革命埋下祸根，并最终导致路易十六被推翻。
description.en: Support for the American Revolutionary War led to a financial crisis in France, planting the seeds for the revolution and ultimately leading to the overthrow of Louis XVI.

description.zh-cn: 法国大革命推翻了旧制度。
description.en: The French Revolution overthrew the Ancien Régime.

description.zh-cn: 法国大革命期间颁布了《人权宣言》这一纲领性文件。
description.en: During the French Revolution, the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen was promulgated as a foundational document.

description.zh-cn: 法国大革命废除了君主制，并于1792年9月22日建立了法兰西第一共和国。
description.en: The French Revolution abolished the monarchy and established the French First Republic on September 22, 1792.

description.zh-cn: 1804年，拿破仑加冕为帝，建立法兰西第一帝国。
description.en: In 1804, Napoleon was crowned emperor, establishing the First French Empire.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑战争结束后，法兰西第一帝国解体。
description.en: After the Napoleonic Wars, the First French Empire was dissolved.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑在滑铁卢战役中战败后被再次流放，其政治生涯终结。
description.en: After his defeat at the Battle of Waterloo, Napoleon was exiled again, ending his political career.

description.zh-cn: 普法战争法国战败，导致法兰西第二帝国垮台。
description.en: The French defeat in the Franco-Prussian War led to the collapse of the Second French Empire.

description.zh-cn: 普法战争法国战败后，法兰西第三共和国成立。
description.en: The French Third Republic was established after France's defeat in the Franco-Prussian War.

description.zh-cn: 尽管法国在第一次世界大战中战胜，但战争损耗极为惨重。
description.en: Although France was victorious in World War I, the war resulted in extremely heavy losses.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次世界大战中，法国于1940年被轴心国占领。
description.en: During World War II, France was occupied by the Axis powers in 1940.

description.zh-cn: 法国被占领后，戴高乐将军在海外组建“自由法国”政府以继续抵抗。
description.en: After the occupation of France, General de Gaulle formed the 'Free France' government in exile to continue the resistance.

description.zh-cn: 盟军在诺曼底登陆，开启了解放法国的进程。
description.en: The Allied landings in Normandy initiated the process of liberating France.

description.zh-cn: 自由法国发动的龙骑兵行动解放了法国南部。
description.en: Operation Dragoon, launched by the Free French forces, liberated the south of France.

relationships.target: 法兰西共和国临时政府

description.zh-cn: 法国解放后，戴高乐成立法兰西共和国临时政府接管法国本土。
description.en: After the liberation of France, de Gaulle established the Provisional Government of the French Republic to take control of mainland France.

description.zh-cn: 法国在第一次印度支那战争中失利，动摇了其殖民统治。
description.en: France's defeat in the First Indochina War shook its colonial rule.

description.zh-cn: 阿尔及利亚战争引发的政治危机最终导致了法兰西第四共和国的垮台。
description.en: The political crisis caused by the Algerian War ultimately led to the collapse of the French Fourth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 因阿尔及利亚战争导致的政局动荡，戴高乐得以重返政坛并建立法兰西第五共和国。
description.en: The political instability caused by the Algerian War allowed de Gaulle to return to power and establish the French Fifth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 1962年签署的《埃维昂协定》结束了阿尔及利亚战争，阿尔及利亚获得独立。
description.en: The Évian Accords, signed in 1962, ended the Algerian War and granted independence to Algeria.

description.zh-cn: 通过1963年签署的《爱丽舍条约》，法国与西德建立了紧密的友好合作关系，推动了法德和解。
description.en: Through the Élysée Treaty signed in 1963, France and West Germany established a close friendly and cooperative relationship, promoting Franco-German reconciliation.

description.zh-cn: 为激励和保护法国人的科学研究精神，路易十四设立法国科学院。
description.en: To encourage and protect the spirit of French scientific research, Louis XIV established the French Academy of Sciences.

description.zh-cn: 卢米埃兄弟对电影的发明与发展有着重大的贡献，被视为电影之父。
description.en: The Lumière brothers made significant contributions to the invention and development of cinema and are considered the fathers of film.

description.zh-cn: 《社会契约论》中主张的主权在民思想是现代议会共和制民主制度的基石。
description.en: The idea of popular sovereignty advocated in 'The Social Contract' is the cornerstone of modern parliamentary republican democratic systems.

description.zh-cn: 法国是联合国的创始会员国之一。
description.en: France is one of the founding members of the United Nations.
